beers.desc: Paragon Off the rack Rum barrel. BARLEY WINE AGED IN RUM BARRELS FOR 18 months. The augmented vanilla notes in this very limited beer is owed to 12 months of ageing in fresh rum barrels. Hidden within are flavours of coconut, nutmeg, and fruit that give way to toffee, molasses and anise with a spirit-forward finish.
beers.name: Paragon Off the Rack Rum Barrel By Rackhouse

beers.desc: As Hawaiian mythology describes, The Nightmarchers were said to be the vanguard warriors of the Chief or Chiefess. Legend is told that on the nights honoring Hawaiian deities, the spirits of these warriors have been seen rising from their burial sites or the ocean and marching in formation to ancient battlegrounds. Honoring ancient Pacific Island culture in this collab with Harland Brewing in San Diego, we packed this stout with Ube (purple sweet potato), toasted coconut, coconut chips and Tahitian vanilla.
beers.name: The Nightmarchers

beers.desc: 1, 2 and 3 year old lambic with 3 varieties of Reine Claude plums. The fresh, overripe, aromatic plums for this beer were harvested in Hageland (Belgium) and Northern France. Exquisitely the plums communicated their graceful yet complex harmony to us. So we blended the plum lambics with this fragility in mind and tried to translate the elegance and appearance of the fruit into the beer. Made with lambics that were aged on barrels that previously held müller thurgau wine, which gives a smooth vinous finish to the beer.
beers.name: Pruim Reine Claude (2019)

beers.desc: Stone Russian Imperial Stout aged in Bourbon Barrels
beers.name: Fyodor's Classic (2015)

beers.desc: As Hawaiian mythology describes, The Nightmarchers were said to be the vanguard warriors of the Chief or Chiefess. Legend is told that on the nights honoring Hawaiian deities, the spirits of these warriors have been seen rising from their burial sites or the ocean and marching in formation to ancient battlegrounds. Honoring ancient Pacific Island culture in this collab with Harland Brewing in San Diego, we packed this stout with Ube (purple sweet potato), toasted coconut, coconut chips and Tahitian vanilla.
beers.name: Firestone 18 (XVIII) Anniversary Ale

beers.desc: English barleywine aged for 18 months in Wild Turkey Rye barrels then treated with roasted apples, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice and graham cracker.
beers.name: Big Sxxxy American Pie

beers.desc: English style pastry barleywine aged 22 months in vanilla bourbon barrels.
beers.name: Bourbon Vanilla Big Sxxxy

beers.desc: An Imperial Stout brewed with ancho chili peppers, cacao nibs, vanilla beans, and cinnamon sticks. Pouring deep brown with a thick head, this beer has a complex body with a delicious lingering roastiness. Abraxas is brewed with unique ingredients intended to challenge and excite the palate. It may be enjoyed right away or allowed to age in the bottle. Vertical tastings are encouraged. Perennial Artisan Ales is a small batch craft brewery dedicated to producing unique, premium beers. Our beers are brewed with the experimental, seasoned craft beer drinker in mind.
beers.name: Abraxas (2021)

beers.desc: An Imperial Blonde Ale or Blonde Barley Wine; Helldorado has the lightest color of any of the beers in our barrel program but carries a great deal of interesting barrel character: vanilla, light char and amazing lavender-honey notes. Rich boozy honey liqueur character and loads of smooth sweet toasted malt to finish. The El Dorado hops dance in the background without playing a dominant role in the flavor profile. This beer gets better and better the longer it is in barrel.
beers.name: Helldorado (2015)

beers.desc: Tart of Darkness is a traditional stout that we aged in used oak barrels from The Bruery that had previously housed beers such as Cuivre or Black Tuesday. We then brought them over to Bruery Terreux, added our special blend of souring bacterias and wild yeasts and watched nature take its course. The result is a perfectly tart yet awesomely dark and roasty, sour stout. Not a style you will see very often, and in our opinion, not a style seen often enough. This unique stout has notes of tart plums, roasted coffee, vanilla and oak.
beers.name: Tart of Darkness (2017)

beers.desc: Smooth and luscious imperial stout with a touch of sea salt and infused with chocola
beers.name: 7th Anniversary Chocolate & Sea Salt Imperial Stout

beers.desc: This Russian Imperial Stout is dedicated to Georgy Zhukov, arguably one of the finest generals of World War II. Opaque black in color, with notes of espresso, chocolate, dark toffee and hints of blackstrap molasses. The English hop varietals provide a subtle herbal dryness, and the beer finishes with a hearty slap of roasty espresso. Pair Marshal Zhukov's with mushroom solyanka, dark chocolate, cherries and ground wars in Russia.
beers.name: Marshal Zhukov's

beers.desc: Imperial stout with pistachio, cacao nibs and vanilla.
beers.name: Deep Orbit Andromeda

beers.desc: Bourbon Barrel Aged Winter Ale with Coffee and Cinnamon.
beers.name: Coffee Cinnamon B-Bomb (2019)

beers.desc: 43 Plato starting gravity. Aged 8 months in Willett Bourbon barrels, then transferred to Buffalo Trace barrels for an additional 16 months.
beers.name: King of Darkness
